snippet: Mario Hernandez’s discovery, after nearly 50 years in the United States, shows how federal bureaucracies can stumble when it comes to immigration status.
abstract: Discovery by Mario Hernandez that he is not an American citizen, despite having lived in United States for nearly 50 years, serving in the Army and having a career in federal agencies, illustrates how government bureaucracies can stumble when it comes to immigration status; Hernandez was brought to US from Cuba when he was 9 years old.
lead_paragraph: Mario Hernandez’s discovery, after nearly 50 years in the United States, shows how federal bureaucracies can stumble when it comes to immigration status.

headline.main: After Forming Deep Roots in U.S., Man Discovers He Isn’t a Citizen
headline.print_headline: After Forming Deep Roots in U.S., Man Discovers He Isn’t a Citizen
